title: Voters going to polls in local elections across Britain
description: A total of 4,851 council seats are up for grabs, with mayors being elected in some areas.

title: French election: Macron declared 'winner' of final debate
description: Emmanuel Macron is widely regarded as having the best of a quarrelsome debate with Marine Le Pen.

title: How the BBC reports polling day
description: The BBC isn't allowed to report details of campaigning while the polls are open.

title: Border counties hold Brexit meeting
description: Councils along the Irish border discuss a report setting out some of the risks and opportunities.

description: With each adult holding an average of three old paper fivers each, the rush is on to get rid of them.

description: Housing charities blame a lack of investment in social housing.

description: A guide to the elections taking place in England, Scotland and Wales on Thursday.

title: Brexit guide
description: A guide to how the UK will leave the European Union following the 23 June referendum vote.

title: Voters' guide
description: The UK will have a general election on 8 June. Here's what you need to know.

title: Woof, woof
description: Britain takes to the polls, and the dogs go too, in the 2017 local and mayoral elections

description: Who is joining George Osborne in stepping down as an MP, and who plans to return?

description: Check candidates running in six regions of England which are holding mayoral elections in 2017.

description: Shadow home secretary Diane Abbott says Labour would fund 10,000 extra police.

title: Blair's legacy
description: Tony Blair came to power 20 years ago - how did he change the UK and what is his lasting legacy?

description: UKIP and the Greens are making electoral pacts with rival parties - what's going on?

title: 'Strong leadership'
description: There is a stark difference between a strong leader and a strong leadership, says Archie Brown.

description: The UK has no MPs after Parliament was prorogued last week and then dissolved in the early hours of Wednesday.

description: It's ungentlemanly to discuss money, but that's what the UK and EU are doing after more speculation.

description: Jeremy Corbyn criticised Theresa May's attack on European politicians.

description: The EU's chief negotiator has set out the European Commission's detailed guidelines.

description: Brexit Secretary David Davis says the UK will pay what's legally required to leave the EU not a "best guess" figure from the European Commission.

description: Theresa May says she will be "bloody difficult" to European Commission president Jean-Claude Juncker.

description: Emmanuel Macron is widely regarded as having the best of a quarrelsome debate with Marine Le Pen.

description: The BBC isn't allowed to report details of campaigning while the polls are open.

description: Councils along the Irish border discuss a report setting out some of the risks and opportunities.

description: Labour lose councils in Wales and Scotland while UKIP suffer losses, as counting continues across Britain.

description: Leader Paul Nuttall is defiant despite losing 70 seats and being wiped out in Lincolnshire and Essex.

description: Labour loses overall control of Glasgow as Tories make gains across many areas of Scotland.

description: Fewer than one in three people voted for any candidate to lead new combined authorities.

description: Liberal Democrats win a crucial county council seat following two recounts and the drawing of straws.

title: Rubbish Party takes seat in Ayrshire
description: Sally Cogley had been campaigning to clamp-down on litter, dog fouling and fly tipping in Irvine Valley.

title: Investigatory Powers: 'Real-time surveillance' in draft update
description: The proposal is included in a leaked paper outlining new surveillance powers for UK authorities.

title: Brexit: English language 'losing importance' - EU's Juncker
description: The EU Commission chief chooses French because English "is losing importance in Europe".

title: UK clean air strategy: Government to publish draft proposals
description: After a protracted legal battle, ministers are forced to reveal anti-pollution proposals.

description: A night of contrasting fortunes and mixed reactions for the parties as election results came in.

title: Juncker: English language is 'losing importance at EU'
description: European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker on giving a key speech in French, not English.

title: David Davis: European Commission 'trying to bully the British people'
description: Brexit Secretary David Davis said there had been a "deliberately misleading briefing" after a dinner with the PM and Jean-Claude Juncker.
